column3: Right, in non-attack scenarios, we never over-allocate (not before and not after this patch). All it does is limit the overallocation by a non-sending stalling attacker to 256 KiB per connection.\n
ACK.  comment deleted.  Need my morning caffeine.\n

If there would have been no hint in the protocol as to how much data to expect, the strategy to first allocate a small buffer would make a lot of sense.

tested ACK
